name: Pale Luna (ORIGINAL FINALLY FOUND)
description:
Description

Pale Luna was a text adventure in the vein of Zork and The Lurking Horror, at a time when said genre was swiftly going out of fashion. 

Collectors have been known to offer upwards of six figures for an authentic copy of the game.

How we found this

Pale Moon is a creepypasta game that for many years was believed to be fictional, but after years of searching by Internet users, a physical copy of the game was finally found.

Purchased from an old owner of a video game and movie shop in San Francisco in 2020, it took a full year for us to contact a user who owned a floppy disk drive into which we could insert the floppy disk and confirm that it was indeed a copy of the mythical game.

Controls

As a text game, the main mechanics is to write commands, whose actions are represented in text on the screen. Pale Moon is an old and probably unfinished game, so his command system is mediocre.

 All commands in this game must be written in capital letters and without a space. For example, "USEGOLD", "GONORTH" or "DIGHOLE" (Without quotation marks")
